intro: Dorobaea, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plants typically have showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pink petals. They are often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. Dorobaea species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
